Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: Load Sensing
Value.Help: Turn on the module when the attached load is connected.

Value.label: LED Status
Value.Help: Set the LED policy: on if the load is on, off if the load is on, or off all the time

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Sensor Binary Report Toggle
Value.Help: Which value of the Sensor Binary Report will be sent when the magnet switch to open/close.

Value.label: Basic Set Toggle
Value.Help: Which value of the Basic Set will be sent when the magnet switch to open/close.

Value.label: Low Battery Check Enable
Value.Help: Enable/disable the function of low battery checking, when the current voltage is less than the warning voltage, it will send the Battery Low Warning Report.

Value.label: Low Battery Check Interval
Value.Help: This parameter is available when the low battery checking function is activated or the device was waked up by other actions (i.e. the z-wave button trigger, magnet switch trigger and the Wake Up Interval Set timeout trigger). The Recessed Door Sensor will check the battery power when it was wake up as other ways. For example: the z-wave button trigger, magnet switch trigger and the Wake Up Interval Set timeout trigger. Default setting: 86640

Value.label: Report Type
Value.Help: Configure which sensor report will be sent when the sensor is Opened/Closed

Item.label: Basic Set and Sensor Binary Report

Value.label: Lock/Unlock Configuration
Value.Help: Lock/ unlock all configuration parameters

Value.label: Device Tag
Value.Help: Device Tag

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults.

Value.label: Night Light
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the switch is lit.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Night Light
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

Value.label: Night Light
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON. Note: If you invert the switches and also install the product upside down, remember the load will now be controlled by the right, not the left switch.

Value.label: Invert switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Remote level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set remotely.

Value.label: Remote duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set remotely.

Value.label: Local level percent
Value.Help: Indicates how much each level dims/brightens as a portion of the whole range when set locally.

Value.label: Local duration per level
Value.Help: Indicates the time duration of each level when set locally.

Value.label: Dipswitches state
Value.Help: Bit mask field that returns the state of the user accessible Dipswitches on the door look. Bit 0 Lock LED Status (1: enable) Bit 1 Auto lock (1: enable) Bit 2 Auto Buzzer (1: enable) Bit 3 Secure Screen (1: enable) *Only for MB 916

Value.label: MSB SKU part numbers
Value.Help: The Configuration Parameter 33 and 34 are used to set the SKU part numbers to the Kwikset locks. Is the first four most significant bytes (MSB). Below describes how Configuration Parameter 33 and 34 are being used. * For a ZW Configuration Set, the DLM will first do a GET_SKU_ID to retrieve the full SKU from the lock, and the lock will respond with all 8 bytes. (If it not yet set, the DLM will consider that as all 0x30s.) The DLM changes only the appropriate 4 bytes in its local copy of the SKU, and it then sends the full 8 bytes down to the lock in a SET_SKU_ID. * For a ZW Configuration Get, the DLM will do a GET_SKU_ID down to the lock, to which the lock will respond with all 8 bytes. The DLM will return the requested 4 bytes via ZW. If the SKU is not set, it will return all 0x30s (ASCII 0s).

Value.label: LSB SKU part numbers
Value.Help: The Configuration Parameter 33 and 34 are used to set the SKU part numbers to the Kwikset locks. Is the least four significant bytes (LSB).

Value.label: lock type
Value.Help: Unique ID of the lock type 910 Z-Wave (Legacy, FW 3.4) 0x00 0x00 912 Z-Wave (Legacy, FW 3.2) 0x00 0x00 910 Z-Wave 0x02 0x36 912 Z-Wave 0x03 0x36 914 Z-Wave 0x04 0x36 916 Z-Wave 0x06 0x42
